messages: dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:13): anyone know about blacklisting? I'm building a newsletter feature for a large client - their email list is all opted in - ie they fill in a form to request to be put on the list - the only chance that someone could get spam is if someone put in some other address for whatever reason, and that recipient didn't request to be on the list. A competing specialist email marketing company is telling them that their system has personal connectio
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:15): ChrisC36: I'd ask #web
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:15): ah way ahead of me :p
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:16): Should I learn HTML or XHTML or what?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:16): HTML first
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:17): :)
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:17): Beltz: http://w3.org/TR/html401/ http://w3.org/Markup/
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:17): dont bother with xhtml its not being used yet, and may never will be
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:17): XHTML is being used more and more
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:18): not by browsers
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:18): you can learn them both at the same time, but if you must choose one to learn first, go with HTML

689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:18): I've made pages for about 8 years, but always with frontpage. However, I can read HTML code. Knowing this, should I just study XHTML since I already know enough basics&
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:19): & was a question mark, right next to ? on french keyboards...
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:19): if you've been using FrontPage, you don't know HTML
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:19): anyways, if you're interested in web stuff (as you apparently are) you should know both
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:19): reisio: I am saying that I can read code
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:19): like I said
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:20): you should know both if you have a real interest, but if you want to learn _one_ _first_, go with HTML
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:20): And on a website that I would make today, I should apply HTML? I dont want my stuff to be incompatible with too many users...
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:20): HTML 4.01 to be exact
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:20): Okay thanks
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:20): ya, HTML 4.01 is far more compatible across browsers than XHTML
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:20): <div> tags are HTML 4 right? It's the one thing ive never used.
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:20): if your code has 'mso' anywhere in it, you need to start over and learn from the beginning
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:21): And I dont wanna use tables, as I usually do.
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:21): they're HTML, ya
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:21): Beltz: I like your thinkin' :)
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:21): ChrisC36: That's why I want to learn actually. My frontpage code for a friend's website is so messed up, so I'm gonna write it with notepad now...
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:22): notepad? well you don't have to be a masochist
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:22): Beltz: might be a good time to get a new text editor, too
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:22): I use Notepad2
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:22): It's like notepad++
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:22): try TopStyle
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:22): or something meant for web
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:22): Okay, I will look it up
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:22): and learn css

689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:22): Can you guys tell me if my site can be made to look very similar to this, but without tables? THis is my earlier frontpage version: http://www.ex-silo.org/secret/goodbackup/
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:23): Yes, my plan is to learn HTML and CSS.
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:23): Beltz: yes, it can
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:23): you might want to start from a 3column template, there are tons online
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:23): 3column _CSS_ template, that is :)
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:24): Ummm... so I can't make that design with just html, before I learn CSS' can I?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:24): Beltz: hrmmm
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:24): Beltz: I bet you could, but it'd be evil
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:24): CSS is what you're supposed to use to lay out HTML elements
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:24): Okay, I thought CSS was mostly for style, as in colors...
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:24): nope, much much more
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:25): imagine your page as nothing but black text on a white background
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:25): all linear, top-to-bottom, no table cells, etc.
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:25): Okay
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:25): from that, you can use CSS to make it _look_ like the table version with all the colors and positioning
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:25): And CSS puts it all together, and then you have to hack it to make it work on retard browsers like ie?
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:26): no CSS is not mostly for style lol
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:26): its for presentation
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:26): Okay
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:26): which includes layout and behaviour
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:26): the goal is to seperate presentation from structure
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:26): I see
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:26): structure is what html is for
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:27): But in general, do you really have to hack your code to make it work with ie, even for something simple like my website?
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:27): for eg. <h1> </h1> is saying this is a top level heading, thats all it says
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:27): any stying or behaviour surroujnding the h1 is in the css file
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:28): Ok
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:28): no you dont have to hack it
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:28): Ie can do css fine, but it does some thing wrong so you will have to know the ins and outs of its shortcomings and work arounds
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:29): most of which are getting fixed in IE7
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:29): I followed a tutorial on suckerfish dropdowns and it kept messing up on ie
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:29): Beltz: http://w3.org/Style/CSS/
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:29): keep things simple to start with and youll be ok
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:29): and I think http://yourhtmlsource.com/ has another decent startup tut
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:29): ChrisC36: separate
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:30): keeping simple doesnt really cover drop down menus
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:30): The problem is that my site pretty much absolutely needs drop down menus... Anyway, when I have re-written the rest, I,ll worry about this.
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:30): the suckerfish drop downs work fine in IE , i've used them
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:31): you need the js thing that applies the style to the non link element so IE can use the hover
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:31): IE will not use hover on anything except for links
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:31): you can do it without JavaScript, it's just goofy :p
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:31): Anyway, at worse if my site doesnt work, #html will come to my rescue
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:31): exactly
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:31): but you're well on your way
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:31): thats just if you want to do the drop down all in a list with css
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:32): I just hope I can learn enough of this in a day or two
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:32): you can still insert a DW generated table code mess
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:32): is css easy to learn like html
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:32): most common mistake people make
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:32): i'll give myself a couple of days and be able to create this site with css
dbe36a27ec29eafa6ea214e51c733ada (23:32): give yourself 3 weeks
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:32): damn
689004476e0e8b1d7ec2ca1aac0b3fca (23:32): even my shitty website?
